ingredients: 2 cups Seeraga Samba rice (or Jeerakasala rice)
Donne leaves or banana leaves for serving (optional but traditional)

steps.title: Make green masala paste
steps.description: Combine fresh coriander leaves, mint leaves, and green chilies in a blender.

steps.title: Grind green masala
steps.description: Add a little water and grind the mixture into a smooth, fine green paste.

steps.title: Begin chicken marination
steps.description: Place the chicken pieces in a large mixing bowl.

steps.title: Add spices and yogurt
steps.description: Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, salt, curd, and ginger-garlic paste to the chicken.

steps.title: Mix in green masala
steps.description: Add the prepared green masala paste to the bowl and mix thoroughly to coat the chicken.

steps.title: Marinate the chicken
steps.description: Cover and let the chicken marinate for at least 30 minutes to absorb the flavors.

steps.title: Wash and soak rice
steps.description: Rinse the Seeraga Samba rice until the water runs clear, then soak it in water for 20 minutes.

steps.title: Parboil the rice
steps.description: Boil water in a large pot, add salt and a few drops of oil, then add the soaked rice and cook until 80% done.

steps.title: Drain and set aside rice
steps.description: Once 80% cooked, drain the rice in a colander and let it rest.

steps.title: Heat ghee and oil
steps.description: In a heavy-bottomed pan, heat ghee and oil on medium heat.

steps.title: Add whole spices
steps.description: Add bay leaves, cloves, cardamom, cinnamon, and fennel seeds to the hot ghee-oil mix. Sauté until aromatic.

steps.title: Sauté onions
steps.description: Add thinly sliced onions to the pan and cook until they turn golden brown.

steps.title: Add tomatoes
steps.description: Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften and blend into the onion mixture.

steps.title: Add marinated chicken
steps.description: Add the marinated chicken along with all the marinade to the pan.

steps.title: Cook chicken
steps.description: Cook on medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is about 80% cooked and the masala thickens.

steps.title: Layer rice over chicken
steps.description: Evenly spread the partially cooked rice over the chicken in the pan.

steps.title: Sprinkle garam masala
steps.description: Sprinkle garam masala powder evenly over the layered rice.

steps.title: Seal and dum cook
steps.description: Cover the pan tightly with a lid. Optionally seal edges with dough and cook on low heat for 15–20 minutes.

steps.title: Let biryani rest
steps.description: Turn off the heat and let the biryani rest, covered, for 10 minutes to allow flavors to settle.

steps.title: Gently mix and serve
steps.description: Open the lid, gently fluff and mix the biryani without breaking the rice grains. Serve hot in donne or banana leaves if available.
